intro: Vochysia eximia, commonly known as the golden tamarind, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that give way to edible, elongated fruits resembling beans. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a food source, while the tree is also valued for its ornamental appeal. Vochysia eximia thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
